Views¶

lavaFlow.views.build_filter(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
lavaFlow.views.build_model_filter(request)¶
lavaFlow.views.consumption_bar_data(request, start_time_js=0, end_time_js=0, exclude_string='', filter_string='', group_string='')¶

Generates consumption data for the consumption chart, this is a total of CPU time, wall time, pend time and the total number of tasks started during this time grouped by whatever the user requires. To make reports clearer when the user requests num_processors, or exit state, these are made human readable.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch, this is converted to the nearest minute
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch, this is converted to the nearest minute
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group by
Returns:

json data object.
lavaFlow.views.consumption_bucket(attempts, group_args, req_start_time, req_end_time)¶
lavaFlow.views.cpu_consumption(request, start_time_js=0, end_time_js=0, exclude_string='', filter_string='', group_string='')¶

Generates CPU consumption data for the cpu usage chart. CPU Usage is the cpu time for the given time period.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group by
Returns:

json data object.
lavaFlow.views.create_js_bad_request(data=None, message='')¶

Takes an optional json serializable object, and an optional message, and creates a standard json response using a HttpResponseBadRequest class.

Parameters:
  • data – json serializable object
  • message – Optional message to include with response
Returns:

HttpResponse object

lavaFlow.views.get_attempts(start_time_js, end_time_js, exclude_string, filter_string)[source]¶

Gets all attempts that are active between the specified time periods, after having applied the filters and exclude options.

Parameters:
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
Returns:

Queryset
lavaFlow.views.get_csrf_token(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns the CSRF token to the client as part of a json document.

Parameters:request – Request object
Returns:HttpResponse with cookie containing JSON data.

lavaFlow.views.openlava_import(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Imports one or more openlava log entries, log entries are uploaded as JSON data in the request body.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • cluster_name – name of cluster (Specified in URL)
Returns:

JSON Status

None

lavaFlow.views.resource_data(request, start_time_js=0, end_time_js=0, exclude_string='', filter_string='', group_string='')¶

Generates resource usage data for the resource chart, this is the average of each field that is available on linux from AttemptResourceUsage.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group by
Returns:

json data object.
lavaFlow.views.submission_bar_data(request, start_time_js=0, end_time_js=0, exclude_string='', filter_string='', group_string='')¶

Generates chart data for the submission chart, this shows when jobs are being submitted into the cluster.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch, this is converted to the nearest minute
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch, this is converted to the nearest minute
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group by
Returns:

json data object.
lavaFlow.views.util_report_range(request, exclude_string='', filter_string='')[source]¶
lavaFlow.views.util_total_attempts(request, start_time_js=None, end_time_js=None, exclude_string='', filter_string='', group_string='')[source]¶
lavaFlow.views.utilization_data(request, start_time_js=0, end_time_js=0, exclude_string='', filter_string='', group_string='')[source]¶

Generates utilization data for the utilization chart, this is essentially number of processors requested, vs number of processors that are in use, for the given time period. Grouped by zero or more fields.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group by
Returns:

json data object.
lavaFlow.views.utilization_table(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generates utilization table for the utilization table

Parameters:
  • request – Request object
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch, rounded to the nearest minute
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch, rounded to the nearest minute
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group by
Returns:

json data object.
lavaFlow.views.utilization_view(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Renders and displays the utilization view page.

Parameters:
  • request – Request object passed by django.
  • start_time_js – Start time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • end_time_js – End time for the chart data, in milliseconds since epoch
  • exclude_string – a string of options to exclude data
  • filter_string – s string of options to filter data
  • group_string – a string of fields to group data by.
Returns:

Rendered HTML page.
